caption:
In the photograph, two men are standing by the water's edge. They are turned away from the camera, looking towards a distant industrial scene featuring multiple smokestacks. The man on the left wears a dark green jacket and pants, while the man on the right is dressed in a white short-sleeved shirt, white pants, and dons a white hat. Both men carry items: the man in white has a black satchel over his shoulder, and the other man appears to have a camera or binoculars hanging off his neck.

The foreground features a wooden barrier partially submerged in water and a bright yellow box labeled "OPERATION" sitting on what looks like a sandy or slightly muddy ground. The water is muddy and calm. The sky is clear with no visible clouds, suggesting a sunny day. Overall, the scene has a solemn, industrial feel, emphasizing water and environmental observation or study.
title: Members of the U.S. Coast Guard's pollution strike force prepare to investigate the damaged Liberian oil tanker. The tanker Naess Mariner was punctured when it collided with a barge on the Mississippi River and large amounts of oil escaped.
